thinking.disposable_income: Edgewater has a median income of $67,796, with a diverse income distribution. About 38% earn less than $50,000, while 32.9% earn over $100,000. The per capita income of $51,717 suggests moderate disposable income levels
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution and high cost of living in Chicago, many residents have limited discretionary spending. The 38% lower-income households would be particularly sensitive to increased transportation costs and sales taxes
thinking.accessibility: The community shows balanced transit and car usage (33.2% transit, 33% drive alone). High proportion (38.8%) have no vehicles, indicating strong transit dependency. Excellent transit access with Red Line and multiple bus routes
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized lower transit fares due to high transit usage and large car-free population. 2. Moderate tax rates to balance service funding with impact on discretionary spending. 3. Support driving fees to improve transit service and reduce congestion. 4. Considered travel time improvements for both modes given mixed-mode usage. 5. Balanced overall cost burden across different income groups
